solution_line_template: So he scored {games_in_season}*{points_per_game}=<<{games_in_season}*{points_per_game}={points_from_touchdowns}>>{points_from_touchdowns} points from touchdowns

He also scored {points_per_conversion}*{two_point_conversions}=<<{points_per_conversion}*{two_point_conversions}={points_from_conversions}>>{points_from_conversions} points from the 2 point conversions
So he scored a total of {points_from_touchdowns}+{points_from_conversions}=<<{points_from_touchdowns}+{points_from_conversions}={total_points}>>{total_points} points
That means he beat the old record by {total_points}-{old_record}=<<{total_points}-{old_record}={points_beat_record}>>{points_beat_record} points
